trailheadName: Lincoln Woods Visitor Center - Kancamagus Highway.
notes: Very large lot at Lincoln Woods - fee area.; overnight parking allowed for multi-day traverses

trailheadName: Lafayette Place Campground or Cannon Mountain Tram parking - Franconia Notch.
notes: Large parking areas at tram and Lafayette Place; very accessible - may need parking fee at tram lot during tourist season.

trailheadName: Nineteen-Mile Brook Trailhead - NH 16, Pinkham Notch.
notes: Medium parking area off NH 16; can fill on weekends

trailheadName: Gale River Trailhead - end of Gale River Loop Road.
notes: Medium lot on Gale River Loop Road; road gated in winter adding a road walk

trailheadName: 19-Mile Brook Trailhead - NH 16. or Imp Trail - NH 16. for loop options
notes: Parking lot for 19-Mile Brook is medium-sized; Imp Trail has roadside parking

trailheadName: Pine Bend Brook - Kancamagus Hwy. or Sabbaday Falls parking - for Sabbaday Brook Trail.
notes: Sabbaday Falls lot is paved and popular - fills with tourists.; Pine Bend is roadside only

trailheadName: Appalachia - US 2, Randolph, NH.
notes: Roadside parking at Appalachia trailhead; can overflow on busy days

trailheadName: Lincoln Woods Visitor Center or Zealand Trailhead - depending on traverse direction.
notes: Large fee lot at Lincoln Woods; medium lot at Zealand trailhead - road closed in winter.

trailheadName: York Pond Road - Bunnell Notch trailhead.
notes: Small parking area at Berlin Fish Hatchery; gate controls access

trailheadName: Signal Ridge Trailhead - Sawyer River Road.
notes: Small lot off Sawyer River Road - road is gated in winter ~2 miles from trailhead.

trailheadName: Mt. Clinton Road - Edmands Path trailhead.
notes: Small lot along Mt. Clinton Rd; road closed in winter - adds 2 miles walk.

trailheadName: AMC Crawford Depot - train station, Route 302.
notes: Park at Crawford Depot or nearby AMC Highland Center - hiker parking area.; often plenty of space

trailheadName: Flume Visitor Center / Whitehouse Trailhead
notes: Large parking area at Flume Visitor Center; hikers use far end of lot

trailheadName: Garfield Trailhead - Gale River Loop Road.
notes: Trailhead has a small parking area; Gale River Loop Rd is closed in winter - adds road walk.

trailheadName: Hale Brook Trailhead - end of Zealand Road, near Zealand Campground.
notes: Small lot on Zealand Road - also serves Zealand Trail overflow.; road closed in winter ~2 miles from trailhead

trailheadName: Hancock Overlook - Kancamagus Highway.
notes: Large paved parking off NH 112 - share with hairpin turn scenic area.; can fill on nice days

trailheadName: Hancock Overlook parking area - Kancamagus Highway.
notes: Large paved overlook parking shared with scenic viewpoint

trailheadName: Rocky Branch Trailhead - Glen Ellis Falls area, NH 16. for standard route; or Glen Boulder Trailhead - HWY 16. for alternate
notes: Rocky Branch lot is roadside parking on Rt 16 south of Pinkham - small, sign present.; Glen Boulder shares large parking with Glen Ellis Falls - crowded on nice days.

trailheadName: Webster-Jackson Trailhead - Route 302 at Crawford Notch.
notes: Roadside parking by trailhead or at AMC Highland Center 0.1 mi away; usually sufficient except peak foliage

trailheadName: Jefferson Notch - Caps Ridge Trail parking.
notes: Small lot at Caps Ridge trailhead off Jefferson Notch Rd; road access seasonal

trailheadName: Lafayette Place - Franconia Notch, I-93 parking area.
notes: Large lot at Lafayette Place but fills early; overflow parking along I-93 northbound

trailheadName: Whitehouse Trail parking - Franconia Notch Bike Path / Flume Visitor Center area.
notes: Parking at Flume Visitor Center - hikers use far lot; bike path connects to Liberty Spring Trail.; no parking directly at Liberty Spring start

trailheadName: Lafayette Place - same as Mount Lafayette, Franconia Notch.
notes: Shared parking with Lafayette loop; plan for early arrival or use shuttle/overflow lots

trailheadName: Appalachia trailhead - US 2, Randolph.
notes: Roadside parking, can be crowded on weekends

trailheadName: Ammonoosuc Ravine trailhead - Base Station Road.
notes: Parking at Marshfield Station/Cog Base parking area - fee may apply.

trailheadName: Moosilauke Ravine Lodge - end of Ravine Lodge Rd.
notes: Lot at Ravine Lodge - private road, closed in winter beyond certain point.

trailheadName: Stony Brook Trailhead - off NH 16 south of Gorham. or end of Bangor Street in Gorham - Carter-Moriah trail start.
notes: Stony Brook has small dirt lot; Gorham end is neighborhood roadside - limited parking, don’t block driveways.

trailheadName: Tripoli Road parking lot
notes: Small lot with fee and toilets; fills quickly – overflow parking along Tripoli Road

trailheadName: Kancamagus Highway - Greeley Ponds trailhead. or Tripoli Road
notes: Kancamagus trailhead has a small lot; Tripoli Road lot has a fee and toilets

trailheadName: Ferncroft Road parking, Wonalancet - private land— hikers lot provided.
notes: Ferncroft lot is large grassy area for hikers; free, fills on nice weekends with hikers for Whiteface/Passaconaway

trailheadName: Crawford Path trailhead - AMC Highland Center, Route 302.
notes: Large parking area at Highland Center or along Mt Clinton Road; very accessible

trailheadName: Waterville Valley Ski Area parking lot #1 - Mt. Tecumseh Trail.
notes: Plenty of parking at ski area year-round - park near trailhead sign at lot #1.. Tripoli Road side accessible in summer only - unpaved road, fee area.

trailheadName: AMC Crawford Depot/Highland Center - Avalon/A-Z Trail start.
notes: Park at Crawford Depot or Highland Center lot; plenty of space typically

trailheadName: AMC Pinkham Notch - 44.2583, -71.2537.
notes: Large paved lot at Pinkham Notch Visitor Center; fills early on busy days

trailheadName: Starr King Trail parking - off Starr King Road in Jefferson.
notes: Small parking area on unpaved Starr King Rd by trailhead sign; if full, park along road without blocking driveways

trailheadName: Ferncroft - Wonalancet. – same as Passaconaway
notes: Large grassy Ferncroft lot; be respectful - private land around.. No facilities except kiosk

trailheadName: Willey House parking area - US 302, Crawford Notch. for Kedron Flume/Ethan Pond Trail approach
notes: At Willey House visitor area - bathrooms, picnic tables available.; ample parking except peak foliage days

trailheadName: Lafayette Place Campground - Lonesome Lake trailhead. or the Mount Kinsman trailhead off NH 116
notes: Lafayette Place has a large parking area with facilities; Mount Kinsman trailhead has limited roadside parking

trailheadName: Pine Bend Brook trailhead - Kancamagus Hwy, Route 112, roadside.
notes: Roadside pull-off on Kanc - no formal lot; park off pavement.

trailheadName: End of Haystack Road - North Twin Trailhead.
notes: Small dirt lot at trailhead; closed in winter - road closure adds ~2 mi from end of Little River Rd.

trailheadName: Lincoln Woods - Kancamagus Highway, Lincoln.
notes: Large lot at Lincoln Woods - fee area.; can fill with tourists and multiple hikes

trailheadName: 19-Mile Brook Trailhead - NH 16. for approach via Carter Dome Trail
notes: Same parking as Carter Dome/Middle Carter - 19-Mile Brook, moderate size.

trailheadName: Mount Kinsman Trail - off NH 116, Easton. or Lafayette Place - for Lonesome Lake/Fishin’ Jimmy approach.
notes: Mount Kinsman Trail has a small roadside lot in Easton; Lafayette Place is large but shared with Franconia hikers

trailheadName: North Twin Trailhead - Haystack Road, summer only.
notes: Trailhead on Haystack Rd - closed in winter.; alternative winter start at end of Little River Road adds mileage

trailheadName: Lincoln Woods - Kancamagus Hwy. or Zealand Trail - depending on traverse direction.
notes: Lincoln Woods has large parking - fee.; Zealand Road trailhead medium - road closed in winter.

trailheadName: Glen Ellis Falls parking - Pinkham Notch, NH 16.
notes: Hiker parking at Glen Ellis Falls pull-off - just south of Pinkham Notch Visitor Center.; ski area parking used if ascending via ski trails

trailheadName: Glen Ellis Falls parking area on NH 16
notes: Parking at Glen Ellis Falls is limited and closed in winter; alternative parking at Pinkham Notch adds mileage

trailheadName: Zealand Trail parking - end of Zealand Road.
notes: Medium-sized lot at end of Zealand Rd - paved.; road closed in snow season ~3.5 extra miles from 302
